attributes.action: Pension rules must be the same for politicians and judiciary as everyone else?
attributes.additional_details: Many people are limiting or cashing in pensions because they cannot afford the unfair and constantly changing taxes on pensions.  If it is fair it should apply to all?  Why are rich MPs and Judges allowed to dodge this tax?
attributes.background: Unfair that politicians and the judiciary should get exemptions on the AA and LTA when other people have to pay big taxes.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. MPs’ pensions are not exempt from the AA and LTA, so we're not sure what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 

Judges who are members of the  Judges Pension Scheme 1993 are exempt, but members of the New Judicial Pension Scheme introduced in April 2015 are not.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government and Parliament to change the rules on pensions for judges.
